meta.job_title: Clinical Assistant or Clinical Associate Professor in Anesthesia and Pain Management

duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage a wide variety of anesthetic cases across a busy hospital, including didactic, laboratory, and clinical training of veterinary medical residents, interns, technicians, and students.
Provide oversight of all daily anesthetized small, large, and exotic animal cases, totaling: 15-25/day.
Encourage independent research, especially that which incorporates training opportunities for veterinary residents, interns, or students.
Clinical practice: 40-50%, Non-clinical Teaching: 15%, Research: 30-40%, Service: 5%.
Perform up to 15-20 lectures and up to 20-30 hours of laboratory work.

education_certification.credential: Terminal Degree - DVM (Doctor of Veterinary Medicine) or equivalent degree. American College of Veterinary Anesthesia and Analgesia (ACVAA) or European College of Veterinary Anesthesia and Analgesia (ECVAA) Board Certification is preferred. Must be eligible to obtain and maintain licensure to practice veterinary medicine in the State of Wisconsin.
